blocks.content: Always check the official website: requirements change.

blocks.title: Which visa do I have? (417 or 462)
content: Age: usually 18‚Äì30 (up to 35 for some countries).

blocks.title: Important
blocks.content: Requirements change. Always verify on the official website.

blocks.title: How to apply (summary)
content: Check email and respond if they request more info

blocks.title: Tip
blocks.content: Save documents to Drive + an offline copy on your phone.

sections.title: Before arrival
sections.description: Cards, hostel, CV, and prep to arrive smoothly.

pages.title: Before arrival
pages.summary: Prep, money, hostel and CV at a glance.

blocks.content: Before you arrive: choose city, plan money, book hostel, prep CVs.

blocks.title: Season strategy
content: North in winter, South in summer

blocks.title: Tip
blocks.content: Pick the city based on your goal: quick job, cost, or vibe.

blocks.title: Tip
blocks.content: Ask for weekly discount or a stable shared room. Also, look for jobs on online boards while you stay there.

blocks.title: Card
content: Avoid fees: choose bank/app with good FX rates.

blocks.title: Tip
blocks.content: Bring printed copies and keep PDFs on your phone.

sections.title: Arrival & paperwork
sections.description: SIM, internet, TFN, certificates and first real steps.

pages.title: SIM & internet
pages.summary: How to get data and not be stranded on day one.

blocks.title: Typical scenario
blocks.content: You arrive with no internet. Get a local SIM in town

blocks.title: Before landing
blocks.content: Download offline Google Maps for the area and check how to get to your hostel.

checklist.text: I downloaded the city offline map
I have a plan to buy a SIM on day one

pages.title: TFN (Tax File Number)
pages.summary: How to apply and what happens if you don‚Äôt have it yet.

blocks.title: What is it?
blocks.content: TFN is your tax number to work and pay taxes.

blocks.title: How to do it
content: Go to the official ATO website
Provide an address to receive it (can take up to 2 weeks)

blocks.title: Set up ATO
content: Open the official ATO page to apply online.

blocks.title: Important
blocks.content: You can start working while the TFN is in process, but tell the employer.

checklist.text: I have a safe address to receive the TFN

pages.title: Certificates (RSA, White Card, USI)
pages.summary: When you need them and how not to pick the wrong state.

blocks.title: Heads up!
blocks.content: Some certificates vary by state. Check if it‚Äôs valid where you‚Äôll work.

blocks.title: Strategy
blocks.content: No need to do them all on day one: get the ones that unlock quick jobs in your state.

checklist.text: I decided if I need RSA now
I decided if I need White Card now
I checked the course is for my state

sections.title: Housing
sections.description: How to find a room, rent, bond and avoid scams.

pages.title: Room in shared flat (Facebook)
pages.summary: Groups, marketplace and how to do inspections right.

blocks.title: Where it all happens
blocks.content: In many cities, Facebook is the hub to find housing (local groups + marketplace).

blocks.title: Usual price
blocks.content: Between 150 and 400 AUD per week.

blocks.title: Process
content: Write on the post and ask for an inspection
Agree on bond and move-in date

blocks.title: Warning
blocks.content: Never pay bond or weeks in advance before seeing the place and meeting the person.

checklist.text: I joined my city's Facebook housing groups
I didn't pay anything before seeing the place

pages.title: Lease
pages.summary: When it‚Äôs worth it and what a lease transfer is.

blocks.title: When it makes sense
blocks.content: If you‚Äôll stay 6‚Äì12 months in the same place, renting via real state agency can be cheaper and better.

blocks.title: Key concepts
content: Lease transfer: change tenant if you leave early (per conditions)

checklist.text: I checked agency options (Real Estate, etc.)

sections.title: Job
sections.description: Apply more to have more options

pages.title: Online
pages.summary: Top 3 channels: Facebook groups, local job sites, and the app map to email CVs.

blocks.title: How to search
content: Join city/state Facebook groups + ‚Äújobs / work / backpacker‚Äù.
Check posts and send a message / CV.

blocks.title: Quick message (click to copy)
blocks.content: Hi! I‚Äôm arriving on (date). Experience in hospitality/cleaning. Available immediately. I send you my CV. Thanks!
Filter by area + ‚Äúimmediate start‚Äù + ‚Äúcasual‚Äù.

blocks.title: Quick steps
content: Find the contact on the map.

blocks.title: Email (click to copy)
blocks.content: Hi, I‚Äôm (Name). I‚Äôm available from (date) and I have experience in (‚Ä¶). CV attached. Thank you!

pages.title: Face to face
pages.summary: How to hand out CVs and talk to the manager.

blocks.title: Routine
content: Ask everyone if they‚Äôre hiring somewhere

blocks.title: Tip
blocks.content: Drop CVs at many places even if it seems unlikely they‚Äôll hire you.

sections.title: Regional, farm & extension
sections.description: 88 days, 6 months, postcodes, paylips and how to make it count.

pages.title: How the extension works
pages.summary: 88 days (2nd year) and 6 months (3rd year), postcodes and hours.

blocks.title: Summary
blocks.content: To go from 1st to 2nd year: 88 days regional. From 2nd to 3rd year: 6 months regional.

blocks.title: Key condition
blocks.content: It‚Äôs not just the job type: the postcode must be on the official list.

blocks.title: Don‚Äôt leave it to the end
blocks.content: If you‚Äôre tight on days/hours you‚Äôll have no buffer. Keep all paylips.

pages.title: Farm types & pay
pages.summary: Harvest vs farm-hand, hourly vs piece rate.

blocks.title: Types
content: Harvest / fruit picking: hourly or piece rate
Farm-hand / general labour: often hourly, many hours

blocks.title: Strategy
blocks.content: If you do piece-rate picking, it‚Äôs hard at first. Once you get rhythm you can earn well.

sections.title: Vehicle
sections.description: Buying, rego, roadworthy and tips so it doesn‚Äôt let you down.

pages.title: Buying a car
pages.summary: What to check and how to avoid a lemon.

blocks.title: üìå Before you start
blocks.content: Most WHVs buy via Facebook Marketplace and local groups.

blocks.title: Beware of ‚Äútoo cheap‚Äù
blocks.content: Too cheap often means hidden issues. If it breaks on the road, it‚Äôll cost you more.

pages.title: Rego / registration
pages.summary: Where to check rego and what happens if it expires.

blocks.title: What is rego
blocks.content: Vehicle registration to drive; depends on each state.

blocks.title: ‚úîÔ∏è Before buying
content: Check active rego and expiry date on the official site.
See which state it‚Äôs registered in (changing state can cost).
NSW: also check the greenslip (mandatory insurance).

blocks.title: üîÅ After buying
content: Transfer rego within deadline: NSW ~14 days, VIC ~14 days, QLD ~14 days.
Pay transfer fee and stamp duty if applicable.
If it expires soon, agree who pays the renewal before signing.

blocks.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è No rego
blocks.content: Driving without rego = big fines and insurance may not cover anything.

pages.title: Roadworthy
pages.summary: Local RWC and differences by state.

blocks.title: What it is
blocks.content: RWC = basic safety inspection done by authorized workshops.

blocks.title: By state
content: VIC / QLD: mandatory to sell or transfer.
NSW: only if rego is expired or from another state (blueslip).
Others: may require it for expired rego or out-of-state vehicles.

blocks.title: üí° Tip
blocks.content: Better pay for an inspection before buying than fix later.

blocks.title: üßæ Before buying
blocks.content: PPSR (VIN), active rego, RWC if needed, VIN matches papers.

blocks.title: üîß Minimum maintenance
content: Oil and filters up to date (every 10‚Äì15k km).
Tyres, brakes and lights before long trips.
Extra water/coolant and oil if going remote.

blocks.title: üÜò Emergencies
content: Roadside assist (RACV, NRMA, RACQ...) is cheap and useful far away.
Carry good tyres and basic tools.

sections.title: Wages, taxes & super
sections.description: Taxes, superannuation and how to understand your net pay.

blocks.title: Essential
blocks.content: Indicative wages; vary by city, experience and contract. Pay is usually weekly or fortnightly.

blocks.title: Key details
content: Casual: a bit more $/h but fewer guarantees.

blocks.title: Practical tip
blocks.content: If you don‚Äôt get a payslip, flag it and ask right away.

pages.title: Taxes and superannuation
pages.summary: What gets withheld and how to claim super when leaving.

blocks.title: Quick
blocks.content: Give your TFN from day one: correct withholding and super in your name. Every pay must come with a payslip.

blocks.title: Key details
content: Payslip: check hours, rate/h, tax withheld and super.
WHV tax: ~15% first bracket; can change yearly (check ATO).
Without TFN they withhold much more.

blocks.title: Practical tip
blocks.content: If they withheld too much, you can recover it in the tax return.

pages.title: Super
pages.summary: Contributions and what to do when you leave.

blocks.title: Essential
blocks.content: Super = mandatory pension. Employer pays ~11% extra to your fund (not from your wage). Give them your fund or they‚Äôll open one.

blocks.title: Key details
content: Note fund name and member number.
New job: give the same fund to avoid scattered balances.

blocks.title: Practical tip
blocks.content: When you leave, request DASP (super) from outside Australia: need TFN, fund details and international account.

blocks.title: Lost super
blocks.content: Multiple funds? Find them on ATO online with TFN and consolidate.
